caption-type.tooltip: What the content of the label will be

display-caption-for.description: Display labels for generic window list buttons
display-caption-for.tooltip:
Never: No windows get labels
Always: All windows get labels
Focused: The window with focus will have a label
One per application pool: Only one label for a set of adjacent application windows

display-caption-for-pined.tooltip:
Never: No pinned windows will have a label
Always: All pinned windows will have labels
Running: Only pinned window that are running will have a label
Focused: Only the pinned window with focus will have a label

hide-caption-for-minimized.tooltip: For groups/pools the label will still show unless all application windows are minimized

display-indicators.tooltip:
Choose if the minimized and the pinned indicator characters will be prepended to button label text. Buttons without a text label will not reserve as much space.
Automatic: The minimized and pinned indicators will only show when space is not constrained.

trailing-pinned-behaviour.description: Add new window buttons ahead of trailing pinned buttons
trailing-pinned-behaviour.tooltip: When enabled, new windows will be added to the left of any pinned buttons currently placed on the right of the window list, effectively this allows you to keep pinned buttons at the end of the window list

label-width.tooltip: This defines the width of the label section of a window list button

number-style.tooltip: Controls how the number of windows in a grouped button is presented. When on a vertical panel, the "label prepend" option is not possible so "icon overlay" will be used instead

group-windows.tooltip:
Grouped: All windows for an application are managed by one button,
Pooled: All window list buttons for an application are pooled side by side,
Automatic: Windows are pooled, and then grouped when space is limited,
One to one: Each window gets their own button with no forced ordering,
Launcher: Only pinned button are shown, behaves like a panel launcher.

display-pinned.tooltip: Controls whether window list buttons can be pinned, and whether each workspace has a unique set of pinned buttons or one common set shared across all workspaces. When in "Common across workspaces" mode the order of the pinned buttons is also maintained across workspaces.

synchronize-pinned.description: Synchronize launcher buttons across all workspaces
synchronize-pinned.tooltip: If enabled, the number and order of launcher buttons on the panel will be synchronize across all workspaces.

show-windows-for-current-monitor.description: Only show windows on the same monitor
show-windows-for-current-monitor.tooltip:
If enabled, this applet instance only manages windows
that are displayed on the same monitor

show-tooltips.description: Show tooltips for window list buttons
show-tooltips.tooltip: Enable to show tooltips using window title or application name when hovering over window list buttons

hide-panel-apps.description: Hide window buttons of pinned buttons on other CassiaWindowList instances
hide-panel-apps.tooltip: When enabled, windows for applications with pinned buttons on other instances of the CassiaWindowList applet will not show up in this window list

button-spacing.tooltip: This defines the spacing between the buttons, the value will be divided in half and added to the left of the icon and to the right of the label on horizontal panels or to the top and button of the icon on vertical panels

menu-show-on-hover.tooltip: If enabled, a popup menu with a list of current windows will show when hovering

show-previews.description: Show window thumbnails in the popup window list menu
show-previews.tooltip:
If enabled, the popup menu will show window thumbnails,
otherwise the menu will only show window titles
(Always disabled when running Cinnamon in Software Rendering Mode)

menu-all-windows-of-pool.description: Show thumbnails for all windows of an application pool
menu-all-windows-of-pool.tooltip: If enabled, a popup menu will contain all the application windows in the application pool rather then just the selected window within the application pool

menu-all-windows-of-auto.description: Show thumbnails for all windows of an application pool
menu-all-windows-of-auto.tooltip: If enabled, a popup menu will contain all the application windows in the application pool rather then just the selected window within the application pool

preview-timeout-show.tooltip:
The waiting time before the thumbnail menu appears when hovering over a button
(Not used when moving directly to a different button in the list)

preview-timeout-hide.description: Time before closing after pointer leaves the menu
preview-timeout-hide.tooltip:
The waiting time for the thumbnail menu to close when leaving a button
(Not used when moving directly to a different button in the list)

grouped-mouse-action-btn1.description: Left button action for grouped buttons
grouped-mouse-action-btn1.tooltip: Action taken when using the left mouse button on a window list entry for a group of windows

launcher-mouse-action-btn1.tooltip: Action taken when using the left mouse button on a launcher button with one or more running windows

mouse-action-btn2.tooltip: Action taken when using the middle mouse button on window list entries

mouse-action-btn8.tooltip: Action taken when using the back mouse button on window list entries

mouse-action-btn9.tooltip: Action taken when using the forward mouse button on window list entries

wheel-adjusts-preview-size.description: Adjust the thumbnail window sizes using the scroll-wheel
wheel-adjusts-preview-size.tooltip: If enabled, the size of thumbnail windows will respond to the mouse scroll-wheel. The new size can have a temporary effect or persist on a global or per application basis

hotkey-bindings.description: Hotkey binding available for assignment to a window
hotkey-bindings.tooltip: Define a list of hotkeys used to bring to the foreground specific windows.

hotkey-minimize.description: Minimize window when hotkey target is already in focus
hotkey-minimize.tooltip: If enabled and application cycling is not enabled or there is only one window for the application, windows will be minimized if the window is already in focus

hotkey-new.description: Open a new window when the application is not running
hotkey-new.tooltip: Start a new window if no window is attached to a hotkey and the hotkey description is an exact match for the application name of a pinned button or a desktop file name

hotkey-sequence.description: Smart numeric hotkeys (using "1" automatically extends to 1-9)
hotkey-sequence.tooltip: If enabled, hotkeys ending with the "1" key (i.e. Alt+1) will automatically create hotkeys 1 through 9 (i.e. Alt+1 through Alt+9). The first 9 windows of the assigned application, as ordered on the window-list, will be activated by the 9 hotkeys.

hotkey-grave-help.description: Use modifier(s) + ` hotkey to show hotkey hint bubbles
hotkey-grave-help.tooltip: If enabled, The hotkey modifier(s) + ` will be registered for each unique modifier set defined in the hotkey list. Using these hotkeys will temporally show a hotkey hint bubble over the button icons.

hotkey-help.description:
Hotkeys can be assigned to a window in two ways:
1) Manual: Use "Assign window to a hotkey" in the button context menu.
2) Automatic:  Enter a "Description" matching an application name or desktop file.
Note: 1) Hotkey not working? it's possible the key combination is already assigned elsewhere. 2) If you remove or rearrange hotkeys, manual hotkey assignments might need to be reassigned. 3) Hotkeys associated with desktop files can not be manually assigned.

adv-mouse-list.tooltip: Define a set of mouse button actions when the Ctrl or Shift keys are pressed.

adv-mouse-help.description:
Note: The above list contents will be incorrectly displayed without this fix:
https://github.com/linuxmint/cinnamon/pull/11908
The edit dialog box values are the correct values and the ones that will take effect.

animate-icon.description: Icon animation when launching new windows
animate-icon.tooltip: When enabled, the icon will animate when launching new windows for an application

backup-file-name.tooltip: If a name is entered here, the configuration of this applet instance will be backed up under that name. Backups will be listed in the Setup Wizard restore page when adding a new instance of CassiaWindowList to a panel.

icon-saturation.tooltip:
Sets the color saturation for icons from 0% (grayscale) to 200%, default is 100%
This option is experimental, some icons are not currently effected by this setting

saturation-application.description: Where to apply the icon color saturation
saturation-application.tooltip:
Which buttons will have the custom icon color saturation applied
This option is only available when the saturation is not set to 100%
